_header: As the child Merlin sat on his fathers knee
Title(s): The Argument of Morien and Merlin
_description: The Argument of Morien and Merlin: alchemical verses — 370 lines in couplets

BodAsh1445.First Lines:
As the Child Merlin sat on hys fathers kneeBlesse me father he said
                    for love and Charitie…
BodAsh1445.Last Lines:
…For that noble Lyon in especiallOf all other beasts he ys
                    most Emperiall
BodAsh1445.Note:
On p. 27 in the upper right corner, ‘Merlyn was before Moryen 100
                    yeares’.
BodAsh1445.Attributed Title:
The argument betweene Morien the Father & Merline the sonne how the
                    philosophers stone should be wrought (p. 27)
BodAsh1445.Editions:
Ashmole,  Elias. 
             Theatrum Chemicum Britannicum.
         London: J. Grimond, 1652: 427-8 (lines 77-94, 100-14 only).
Taylor,  F. Sherwood. 
             “The Argument of Morien and Merlin—An English Alchemical Poem.” 
             Chymia
         1 (University of Pennsylvania, 1948): 23-35: 1.26-35.
